name: pure-storage-flasharray
label: Pure Storage FlashArray
description: Pure Storage is a leading provider of enterprise data storage solutions. It is specialize in all-flash storage arrays, delivering high-performance, reliable, and scalable storage solutions for businesses. With Pure Storage FlashArray, organizations can accelerate applications, improve productivity, and make data-driven decisions. Experience the power of next-generation storage technology with Pure Storage FlashArray.

fields.name: server_url
fields.title: Server URL
fields.tooltip: Specify the server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations
fields.description: Specify the server name or IP address to which you will connect and perform the automated operations. By default it is set to https://api.pure1.purestorage.com

fields.name: iss
fields.title: Issuer
fields.tooltip: Specify the application ID for the Pure1 or API client's trusted identity issuer on the array.
fields.description: Specify the application ID for the Pure1 or API client's trusted identity issuer on the array.

fields.name: sub
fields.title: User Name
fields.tooltip: Specify the login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system.
fields.description: Specify the login name of the array user for whom the token should be issued. This must be a valid user in the system.

fields.name: aud
fields.title: Client ID
fields.tooltip: Client ID of the API client that issues the identity token.
fields.description: Client ID of the API client that issues the identity token.

fields.name: kid
fields.title: Key ID
fields.tooltip: Specify the Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token.
fields.description: Specify the Key ID of the API client that issues the identity token.

fields.name: private_key_type
fields.title: Private Key Type
fields.tooltip: Specify the type of private key which is paired with the API client's public key.
fields.description: Specify the type of private key which is paired with the API client's public key.

Encrypted.name: private_key
Encrypted.title: Private Key
Encrypted.tooltip: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.
Encrypted.description: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.

Encrypted.name: passphrase
Encrypted.title: Passphrase
Encrypted.tooltip: Specify the passphrase of private key with which it is encrypted
Encrypted.description: Specify the passphrase of private key with which it is encrypted

Not Encrypted.name: private_key
Not Encrypted.title: Private Key
Not Encrypted.tooltip: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.
Not Encrypted.description: Specify the private key which is paired with the API client's public key.

fields.name: api_version
fields.title: API Version
fields.tooltip: Specify the API version of the Pure Storage FlashArray. By default it is set to 2.23
fields.description: (Optional) Specify the API version of the Pure Storage FlashArray. By default it is set to 2.23.

fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.description:
Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.
By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Alert List
operations.description: Retrieves information about alerts generated on FlashArray. Alerts indicate significant events that occur on an array.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve Alerts from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve Alerts from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Alert IDs or Alert Names.

Alert IDs.name: ids
Alert IDs.title: Alert IDs
Alert IDs.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated alert IDs to retrieve the corresponding alerts. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.
Alert IDs.description: Specify the comma-separated alert IDs to retrieve the corresponding alerts. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.

Alert Names.name: names
Alert Names.title: Alert Names
Alert Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated alert names to retrieve the corresponding alerts. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.
Alert Names.description: Specify the comma-separated alert names to retrieve the corresponding alerts. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required alerts. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required alerts. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters. e.g. id='alert_id' and state='closed'

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify fields to sort the alerts. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields to sort the alerts. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name.e.g. id, name-.  Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: flagged
parameters.title: Flagged
parameters.tooltip: Select True if you want to retrieve only flagged alerts or False for unflagged alerts. If not specified, lists all alerts.
parameters.description: Select True if you want to retrieve only flagged alerts or False for unflagged alerts. If not specified, lists all alerts.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.
parameters.description: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.By default it set to false.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.title: Offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.

operations.title: Get Array List
operations.description: Retrieves information about FlashArray storage appliances from Pure Storage.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve arrays from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve arrays from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Array IDs or Array Names.

Array IDs.name: ids
Array IDs.title: Array IDs
Array IDs.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated array IDs to retrieve the corresponding arrays. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.
Array IDs.description: Specify the comma-separated array IDs to retrieve the corresponding arrays. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.

Array Names.name: names
Array Names.title: Array Names
Array Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated array names to retrieve the corresponding arrays. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.
Array Names.description: Specify the comma-separated array names to retrieve the corresponding arrays. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required arrays. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required arrays. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters. e.g. os='os_1' and parity='1.0'

parameters.name: fqdns
parameters.title: FQDNs
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated resource FQDNs. If there is not at least one resource that matches each fqdn element, an error is returned.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the comma-separated resource FQDNs. If there is not at least one resource that matches each fqdn element, an error is returned.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify fields to sort the arrays. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields to sort the arrays. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. e.g. space.total_provisioned, id. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.
parameters.description: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.By default it set to false.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.title: Offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.

operations.title: Get Directory List
operations.description: Retrieves information about FlashArray managed directory objects from Pure Storage.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve directories from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve directories from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Directory IDs or Directory Names.

Directory IDs.name: ids
Directory IDs.title: Directory IDs
Directory IDs.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated directory IDs to retrieve the corresponding directories. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.
Directory IDs.description: Specify the comma-separated directory IDs to retrieve the corresponding directories. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.

Directory Names.name: names
Directory Names.title: Directory Names
Directory Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated directory names to retrieve the corresponding directories. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.
Directory Names.description: Specify the comma-separated directory names to retrieve the corresponding directories. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.

parameters.name: filesystem_filter
parameters.title: File System Filter
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve directories from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve directories from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: File System IDs or File System Names.

File System IDs.name: file_system_ids
File System IDs.title: File System IDs
File System IDs.tooltip: Specify the file system ID to perform the operation . Enter multiple file system IDs in comma-separated format.
File System IDs.description: Specify the file system ID to perform the operation . Enter multiple file system IDs in comma-separated format. For example file_system_id1, file_system_id2.

File System Names.name: file_system_names
File System Names.title: File System Names
File System Names.tooltip: Specify the file system name to perform the operation. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.
File System Names.description: Specify the file system name to perform the operation. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned. For example filesystem1,filesystem2.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required directories. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required directories. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify fields to sort the directories. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields to sort the directories. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: destroyed
parameters.title: Destroyed
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to false, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
parameters.description: If set to true, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to false, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.
parameters.description: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.By default it set to false.

parameters.name: total_only
parameters.title: Total Only
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, returns the aggregate value of all items after filtering. Where it makes more sense, the average value is displayed instead. The values are displayed for each name where meaningful. If total_only=true, the items list will be empty.
parameters.description: If set to true, returns the aggregate value of all items after filtering. Where it makes more sense, the average value is displayed instead. The values are displayed for each name where meaningful. If total_only=true, the items list will be empty. By default set to False.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.

parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.

operations.title: Get Protection Group List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of protection groups, including their associated source arrays, replication targets, hosts, host groups, and volumes from Pure Storage. The list includes protection groups that were created on the local array to replicate snapshot data to other arrays or offload targets, created on a remote array and replicated asynchronously to this array, or created inside a pod on a remote array and stretched to the local array.

parameters.name: names
parameters.title: Protection Group Names
parameters.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated protection group names to retrieve the corresponding protection groups. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the comma-separated protection group names to retrieve the corresponding protection groups. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required protection groups. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required protection groups. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters. e.g. eradication_config.manual_eradication!='enabled' or pod.name='pod1'

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify fields to sort the protection groups. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields to sort the protection groups. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name.e.g. space.snapshots-, name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: destroyed
parameters.title: Destroyed
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to false, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
parameters.description: If set to true, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to false, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.
parameters.description: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.By default it set to false.

parameters.name: total_only
parameters.title: Total Only
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, returns the aggregate value of all items after filtering. Where it makes more sense, the average value is displayed instead. The values are displayed for each name where meaningful. If total_only=true, the items list will be empty.
parameters.description: If set to true, returns the aggregate value of all items after filtering. Where it makes more sense, the average value is displayed instead. The values are displayed for each name where meaningful. If total_only=true, the items list will be empty. By default set to False.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.title: Offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.

operations.title: Get Session List
operations.description: Retrieves information about session for user login events performed in the Purity//FA GUI, CLI, and REST API.

parameters.name: based_on
parameters.title: Based on
parameters.tooltip: Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve session from Pure Storage.
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the parameter using which you want to retrieve session from Pure Storage. You can choose from the following options: Session IDs or Session Names.

Session IDs.name: ids
Session IDs.title: Session IDs
Session IDs.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated session IDs to retrieve the corresponding sessions. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.
Session IDs.description: Specify the comma-separated session IDs to retrieve the corresponding sessions. If there is not at least one resource that matches each id element, an error is returned.

Session Names.name: names
Session Names.title: Session Names
Session Names.tooltip: Specify the comma-separated session names to retrieve the corresponding sessions. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.
Session Names.description: Specify the comma-separated session names to retrieve the corresponding sessions. If there is not at least one resource that matches each name element, an error is returned.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.title: Filter Query
parameters.tooltip: Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required sessions. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the filter criteria to retrieve required sessions. Single quotes are required around all strings inside the filters. e.g. event='failed authentication' and event_count>3

parameters.name: sort
parameters.title: Sort Fields
parameters.tooltip: Specify fields to sort the sessions. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify fields to sort the sessions. If you want to sort in descending order then append '-' to the field name. e.g. event_count-, end_time-. Note: If you provide a sort you will not get a continuation token in the response.

parameters.name: total_item_count
parameters.title: Total Count
parameters.tooltip: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.
parameters.description: If set to true, the total_item_count matching the specified query parameters is calculated and returned in the response. If set to false, the total_item_count is null in the response. This may speed up queries where the total_item_count is large.By default it set to false.

parameters.name: continuation_token
parameters.title: Continuation Token
parameters.tooltip: Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify continuation token returned in the continuation_token field of previous request to iterate on collection.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.title: Offset
parameters.tooltip: Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the offset of the first resource to return from a collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.title: Limit
parameters.tooltip: Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of resources to be retrieve in this request. By default it will retrieve 1000 resources.
